dataStructure.name: sid.org.tmforum.tip.enterprise.risk.sec.evt.SecurityEvent
dataStructure.description:
A change of state that has significance for the security of a Configuration Item or IT Service. SecurityEvents are designed to carry information about network defense-related activities that are sensed on networks and network-connected devices. SecurityEvents can be either assessed in depth to determine if successful intrusions or compromises resulted, or they can be aggregated to characterize the threat environment.

This entity is abstract

This entity is optional
dataStructure.label: SecurityEvent

child.name: id
child.description:
The primary identifier for the event. Alternate identifiers are contained in EntityIdentification.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: id

child.name: name
child.description:
User defined name to add meaning to an event.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: name

child.name: validFor
child.description:
The start and end time the event occured during.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: validFor

child.name: comments
child.description:
Free text field for security analyst comments associated with an event.

This element is generated from an attribute.

This attribute is optional
child.label: comments
